{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has a history of two second-trimester abortions. This suggests an issue with the uterus or fallopian tubes that may be causing repeated miscarriages. Therefore, I would recommend starting with a TVS (transvaginal ultrasound) to evaluate the uterine lining and rule out any structural issues such as fibroids or polyps. Additionally, a hysteroscopy could also be used to visualize the uterine cavity directly.", "answer_choice": "A"}
